model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!
Speaker B: Have you been hiking lately?
Speaker A: Yes I did actually. I lead some friends on a hike in a local trail last weekend. They got tired really quickly as they never go hiking they told me.

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker A enjoys going on camping trips and hiking trails in parks, and has planned several camping trips for the summer. She will also be doing a part of the Appalachian Trail for 10 days.
2. Speaker A has a pet parrot named Tasha and works as a personal trainer leading hikes. This led to Speaker A becoming a personal trainer who loves camping in remote areas. Recently, Speaker B went on a long hike and enjoyed it.

2. Speaker A has a pet parrot named Tasha and works as a personal trainer leading hikes. This led to Speaker A becoming a personal trainer who loves camping in remote areas. Recently, Speaker B went on a long hike and enjoyed it.
speaker: Speaker B
raw_prediction: It's great that you're getting others out on the trails with you, even if they tire out quickly!
prediction:
Brief explanation: The memory contains useful background information, such as Speaker A's hobby of hiking and being a personal trainer who leads hikes. This information may enable Speaker B to continue the conversation more naturally and contextually.
Judgement: Yes
